snippet: Laurence D. Fink of BlackRock urged 500 chief executives in a letter to stop providing quarterly earnings estimates.
abstract: Andrew Ross Sorkin DealBook column says BlackRock co-founder and chief executive Laurence D Fink sent letter to 500 chief executives urging them for first time to cease giving quarterly earnings estimates; points out provocative proposal is meant to curtail companies' short-term focus on quarterly results.
lead_paragraph: Laurence D. Fink of BlackRock urged 500 chief executives in a letter to stop providing quarterly earnings estimates.

headline.print_headline: Some Heresy on Wall St.: Look Past the Quarter
